metadata.Name: Maknuune
metadata.Description: Maknuune is a large, open Palestinian Arabic lexicon with over 36,000 entries from 17,000 lemmas. Entries include diacritized Arabic orthography, phonological transcription, English glosses, and sometimes MSA glosses, examples, or notes on grammar, usage, or location.
Provider: University College of Educational Sciences - UNRWA
metadata.Paper Title: Maknuune: A Large Open Palestinian Arabic Lexicon
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the Language Resources and Evaluation Conference
Affiliations: University College of Educational Sciences - UNRWA
metadata.Abstract: Wepresent Maknuune مَكْنُونة, a large open lexicon for the Palestinian Arabic dialect. Maknuune has over 36K entries from 17K lemmas, and 3.7K roots. All entries include diacritized Arabic orthography, phonological transcription and English glosses. Some entries are enriched with additional information such as broken plurals and templatic feminine forms, associated phrases and collocations, Standard Arabic glosses, and examples or notes on grammar, usage, or location of collected entry.
